group_1.narration: I stare at the detonator,@it fits in the palm of my hand and@has only one simple button.
I don't know how it works, but since@Hanna made it that way, pressing this button@will be enough to detonate all the bombs@in the town at once.

group_1.textLeft: (Just by pressing this button,@everything will be gone...)

group_1.narration: I wasn't afraid.@I didn't feel guilty either.
It was lonesome.

group_1.textRight: Alright then... Shall I do a countdown?
I start from 10 seconds and when I reach zero,@press the button.
...And then, it will be a clean end.
Are you really okay?@You won't regret this...?

group_1.narration: As Hanna starts the countdown,@I realize I'll never be normal...@Everything that has pushed me to such a reality@will soon be gone.
That cafe will vanish soon.
It was a place of shady deals and@police surveillance.@It's better if it's wiped clean.@I won't regret it.
Or should I say that even the owner@was kind to me in some ways?
Even the townspeople who turned their backs on me@were kind to me at first...
...That's impossible.@It's better if all these memories disappear.
Yes, those memories should vanish...
...But.
I don't want the memories of running the cafe@with Hanna to be gone...
It was really a short time, we were@like normal girls...@We were busy, but we had a lot of fun...
...I don't want to lose those memories.
I don't want to lose the memories@of making Hanna lots of food.
Even that time when she said she could eat anything,@but struggled while eating bell peppers.
If she finds them so bitter,@maybe she can't really drink coffee?
I'm sure that was...@her usual bluff...
*Giggle* She is so cute...
I remember eating crepes together,@and after that, we looked at clothes together.@I remember how Hanna looked better@in long skirts than in pants...
And that time we went to karaoke and I was like,@"Wow, you sing songs like that...@You have such a strong view of the world, Hanna..."@*Giggle* Should I forget that?
But, I don't want to lose them.
No matter the place or the situation,@Hanna will always be there.
That's why they shine so brightly.
I have so many bad memories of this town,@and I really want to lose them.
But in exchange for that...@I don't want to lose the memories with Hanna.
[textBlack:"...Huh?!"]
It's a merry-go-round...
In front of me,@a slightly damaged merry-go-round@shone with dazzling lights@as it slowly started spinning.
It seemed to dance in the light...@The spinning, dazzling merry-go-round,@proving its existence with its beauty,@seemed incredibly precious.
There were other attractions around.@Ah, this was an amusement park...@Except for the faint outside lights,@everything else was swallowed by darkness.
Yet, the merry-go-round kept shining brightly,@forever and ever...as if in a world of hope.
The detonator I held tightly had fallen to the ground,@and instead, Hanna was gently holding my hand.
―Mikoto―@It's beautiful...
―Hanna―@It took a lot of work to fix it...
―Mikoto―@Did you fix this?
―Hanna―@Who else would do it... I faked collecting gunpowder@and secretly fixed the merry-go-round.
―Hanna―@Oh, just to clarify, those bombs were fake.@They look real, but they won't explode.
―Hanna―@...I mean, there's no way I'd let you kill someone.
―Hanna―@Well...when you dropped the bomb, I was kinda nervous@inside that you'd find out it was a fake...hahaha.
―Mikoto―@Why would you...
―Hanna―@It's good they were fake, right?@I just wanted you to remember that feeling.
―Mikoto―@What about this merry-go-round...?
―Hanna―@Oh, this one...?@The reason I fixed it...
―Hanna―@is because I just wanted to show you@something beautiful...
―Hanna―@...You couldn't make any good memories here, right?
―Hanna―@I want to give you lots of good memories.
―Hanna―@I want you to keep smiling.
―Hanna―@So... Look, isn't it beautiful?@Aren't you happy...?
―Hanna―@I worked so hard to make you enjoy this.
―Mikoto―@For such a thing...
―Hanna―@Not just that...@That's everything to me.
―Mikoto―@...Hanna...
―Hanna―@If you have a bad experience,@I'll rewrite it with beautiful memories.
―Hanna―@If you get sad, I'll make you smile@no matter what it takes.
―Hanna―@So... Smile for me, Sena.
―Mikoto―@...I...smile...
―Mikoto―@...always...smile...
―Hanna―@No... You're crying.
―Mikoto―@You did something stupid...
―Mikoto―@You're always like that,@always trying so hard for me!
―Mikoto―@And then you show me something sparkling!
―Mikoto―@...Just like that night view.
―Mikoto―@Hey Hanna, you don't seem to understand,@so I'll explain it to you properly.
―Mikoto―@You are my hope.
―Mikoto―@It's not that the world is shining...@My world is shining because of you.
―Mikoto―@I've always...always...*sniff*...
―Mikoto―@wanted to see this light with you...*sniff*...
―Hanna―@...Is that so...?
―Mikoto―@Yes.
―Mikoto―@...You're an idiot.
And so, hand in hand,@we headed towards the merry-go-round,@where we sat perched on top of the moving horse,@just in time.
The horse went round and round,@round and round,@and everything seemed to sparkle@as it spun in the twinkling light like that.
When I turned around,@I saw Hanna smiling,@so I smiled too.
The light she created was truly beautiful...@With that, I felt like I wouldn't be sad.
...I was so happy...
